profile_data.summary:
Currently diving deep into the world of artificial intelligence as an AI Research Intern at Farm United. Here, I’m working on some exciting projects like developing computer vision solutions for tea pest detection and implementing crop yield prediction models that help farmers make informed decisions directly impacting agricultural practices.

During my time as a Graduate Research Assistant at SETH Labs, I had the opportunity to replicate data collection for the EmoHeVRDB dataset. I achieved a notable 69.84% FER accuracy using EfficientNet-B0, which was both challenging and rewarding. This experience taught me the importance of precision in machine learning applications—something I carry into every project I tackle.

Before my current role, I worked as an RPA Developer at Genpact where I revamped Intelligent Word Recognition for handwritten cheque processing. This initiative not only reduced operational costs by 43% but also improved accuracy by 12%. Collaborating with teams to automate processes was incredibly fulfilling and reinforced my belief in technology’s potential to streamline operations.

My journey began with software engineering where I engineered three back-end APIs for a Twitter Clone web application using Node.js—achieving sub-200ms response times. Each step along the way has shaped my understanding of how different technologies interconnect to solve real-world problems.

Outside of work, I enjoy being part of communities that foster learning and collaboration. As part of the management committee at IE E&E Students' Chapter in Manipal, I helped organize various workshops and events that brought together students eager to learn about emerging technologies.

If you’re interested in discussing AI & ML opportunities or just want to connect over shared interests in technology, feel free to reach out via email at prantarborah2015@gmail.com or check out my work on GitHub: https://github.com/PrantarBorah.

Skills:
- Artificial Intelligence
- Machine Learning
- Natural Language Processing
- Computer Vision
- Robotic Process Automation
- Backend Development (Node.js)

experience.description: I am focusing on developing innovative solutions for agricultural challenges. I spearheaded the development of computer vision solutions for tea pest detection, implemented crop yield prediction models, and currently integrating Google GraphCast for flood prediction systems. Analyzing satellite imagery for crop health assessment was a key aspect of my work, contributing to the development of crop selection and income prediction models.

projects.description: Developed a skin lesion segmentation model using the Attention U-Net architecture to enhance segmentation accuracy in medical image analysis. Leveraged the ISIC 2018 dataset, applying advanced preprocessing techniques and attention mechanisms for improved focus on relevant regions. Achieved a Dice Coefficient of 0.84 and IoU of 0.72, demonstrating robust performance in delineating lesion boundaries. Contributed to advancements in medical image segmentation through effective use of attention mechanisms and evaluation metrics like sensitivity (84.19%) and specificity (95.68%).
projects.title: Skin Lesion Image Segmentation

projects.description:
The data used for ARIMA modeling were historical daily prices of the 'AAPL' stock symbol of the Yahoo! Finance dataset extracted by the quantmod package in R.  Obtained data going back from 2018-01-02 to 2022-12-30 for the index.  The adjusted closing price was chosen to be modeled and predicted. This is because the adjusted closing price reflects not only the closing price as a starting point, but it takes into account factors such as dividends, stock splits and new stock offerings to determine a value. 

A train and test set was created. The range was as follows:

Training Set Range: 02 Jan 2018 - 03 Jan 2022

Test Set Range: 04 Jan 2022 - 30 Dec 2022

One-Step Ahead Forecasting with Accuracy Metrics:
RMSE:  3.373887 
MAPE:  1.738711 
MAE:  2.627818 
ME:  -0.2145753 
MPE:  -0.1672675
projects.title: Stock Market Forecasting using ARIMA modeling in R (AAPL stock)

member.occupation: AI Research Intern@FarmUnited || Actively looking for Full-Time AI & ML Engineer roles || NLP || Prev: Genpact

projects.description:
Engaged in an extensive research project to develop a predictive model for visceral adipose tissue (VAT) mass, based on a comprehensive analysis of data from the 2017-2018 NHANES. Conducted a detailed evaluation of various factors to assess their influence on VAT mass. Implemented multiple variable selection procedures, successfully identifying a set of key predictors: snoring, average sleep hours on weekdays, gender, age, weight, BMI, and waist circumference.
Demonstrated adaptability and critical thinking by revising initial hypotheses, notably finding no significant correlation between VAT mass and consumption of fast food, frozen meals, or non-home cooked meals. Contributed insights into the complex relationship between lifestyle factors and visceral fat, highlighting snoring and sleep duration as novel predictors. Proposed future research directions to enhance model accuracy, suggesting exploration of mental health, prescription medications, dietary supplements, and socioeconomic factors. Identified anomalies in data trends, such as the unexpected regression coefficient for weight, indicating areas for further investigation to refine the model.
projects.title: Application of Modeling Techniques for Predicting Body Fat Content

member.occupation: AI Research Intern@FarmUnited || Actively looking for Full-Time AI & ML Engineer roles || NLP || Prev: Genpact

projects.description: Designed and implemented an extensive football league results model using RStudio, integrating static maximum likelihood and Bayesian models. Executed dynamic Bayesian models and performed sensitivity tests, adjusting prior distributions to enhance accuracy. Proficiently interpreted parameter estimates and produced predictive intervals for team-specific football abilities. Ensured model robustness through meticulous graphical posterior predictive checks, validating the accuracy of predictions. Performed the extraction of precise out-of-sample forecasts.
projects.title: Modeling Football League Results (Serie-A Data)

projects.description: Developed a robust classifier to predict whether a student will drop out or graduate by implementing Random Forest, Support Vector, and Logistic Regression models with a 91% accuracy rate following thorough data cleaning, feature encoding, and evaluating after grouping them by category and creating a correlation heatmap of each category to get a sense of which aspect of a student’s life impacts the dropout rate more.
projects.title: Predicting Student Dropout and Academic Success
